boardgame.name: Zombicide: Chronicles Free RPG Day Mission Booklet
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

This booklet contains 3 original missions for you to start your adventures in Zombicide: Chronicles - The Roleplaying Game.

listing.notes:
ZOMBICIDE CHRONICLES Free RPG Day 2021 CMON MISSION BOOKLET in unused like new condition.
One of this year’s leanest offerings comes courtesy of CMON, This is a vicious little set of encounters to enjoy. The first takes place on a cruise ship, the second at a fancy day spa, and the third inside a dimly lit a parking garage. Expect brutal, bloody affairs in line with the blood-soaked board game series.
New! Unused Shipping and BGG Fees $6
Like New, looked through. Shipped Priority Mail anywhere in the US in padded envelope $10

boardgame.name: Parcel men
Parcelmen
boardgame.description:
Parcelmen is a board game for 1 to 4 players. Here, you can become a delivery driver, planner or a dispatcher – simply anyone involved in delivering a parcel from the sender to recipient. You will be planning routes, organising collections and distributions and doing your best to get your courier company running like clockwork. Whether you succeed will depend on your ability to plan effectively as well as on your ability to improvise and make good use of all your resources!

Players plan to deliver parcel to the right address. A player can choose from 4 actions from drawing new parcels to checking on delayed and undelivered parcels. Players get points for delivering their parcels. The game ends after 5 rounds and the player who scores the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Seventh Edition): Planetary Onslaught
boardgame.description:
Invade and Conquer

For the war-torn worlds of the 41st Millenium, the question is not if the invader will come - merely when. Rumbling into low orbit over far-flung planets, colossal battleships herald their arrival with ground-ripping bombardments.

Planetary Onslaught provides missions and new campaigns that enable you to recreate each stage of an invasion on the tabletop, with one player assuming the role of attacker and one assuming the defender.

It offers new rules for Planetstrikes, Siege Warfare, and Cities of Death. It also provides datasheets for fortifications and terrain.

boardgame.name: Bang! Dynamite Box
boardgame.description:
The Dynamite Box is a special edition of the western game Bang! that contains everything that has been released so far for the card series.

Bang! Dynamite box contains base game Bang! with Dodge City, High Noon, The Valley of Shadows, Wild West Show, A Fistful of Cards, Gold Rush, Armed & Dangerous and The Great Train Robbery expansions

Dynamite box also contains bonus wooden dynamite.

boardgame.name: The Pack
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

On the first day of every hundredth year magic, The Pack, and The Snarl return to the realm of mortals. “We are The Pack,” says an authority that speaks to every living creature. “If your Heart is ready you can enter The Snarl. If your Will is strong you can reach its end. If you are First, we will reward you with your greatest desire. Come find us.” On the first day of the next year, all of that disappears for another 99 years.

boardgame.name: A Groats-Worth of Grotesques
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A Groats-Worth of Grotesques, or, The Baroque Bestiary

Being a system agnostic role playing supplemental treatise on monsters, including four-footed beasts, serpents, and the theater of insects; or, lesser living creatures: as bees, leeches, spiders, worms, as well as certain secret wonders of the inner and outer worlds.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: The Skull as a Complete Gentleman Company

boardgame.name: Voyage to the True World
boardgame.description:
The Sea Voyage from Faerûn to Maztica

Levels 4-6

From the introduction:

The Second Sundering has brought the True World back to Toril after its century long exile on Abeir. It's been just about a decade and now with its rediscovery, ships laden with goods begin to set sail once again searching for unknown wonders.

boardgame.name: The Light of Hope
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

With the continual darkness still overhead, adventurers embark on a journey to deliver Good Mead supplies to some of the Ten-Towns to lighten the mood and allow people to blow off steam. On the journey, the characters will be providing joy, light, hope, celebrations, competition, honey wine, and baked goods.

A 4-hour adventure for 5th to 10th level characters (Optimized for: APL 8), and uses the Dungeoncraft seed Winter's Over.

Maps are included as a separate download for use in your favourite VTT environment.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Honey... Where's the Money?
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A pair of very attractive elves may have just swindled a mead bottler out of an entire shipment of fine craft mead meant for the rowdiest tavern in Easthaven. To make matters worse, his wife is the one who books all the shipping. She is furious!

A Four -Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

Honey... Where's The Money?
Adventure Code: DC-POA-JCDC-01
Dungeoncraft Adventure Seed: Do You Know the Way to Lonelywood?
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Xanathar's Secret Stash
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Xanathar's Secret Stash allows adventurers to discover new magical items to bolster their heroic exploits. The book includes over 100 magic items, covering uncommon to artifact.

boardgame.name: Frozen River Caverns
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Walls of ice form this network of frozen caverns. Running through it is a river down a steep cliff, with slippery ice bridges spanning over it high above.

boardgame.name: Black Ice Gully
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Light snow dusts the ground and frozen undergrowth, crunching with every step. The cold bites into your fingers and your boots slip on cracked sheets of ice. They’ve formed where the stream’s waterways once flowed between rising outcrops of stone. Mounds of rubble make the ground even more treacherous.

Around you the trees loom tall, snow sprinkling down from their leaves as the wind rustles through them. Small flower blossoms, crisply frozen, wait to melt under the promising kiss of sunlight.

boardgame.name: Alchemist's Greenhouse Laboratory
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Located within the heart of a city, this alchemist’s greenhouse laboratory grows luscious plants within. Tall, spiked fences surround it, protecting its valuable contents from trespassers. Alchemical preparation tables stand laden in the greenhouse, while storage barrels and bottles of potions wait further in.
Yet another room is solely dedicated to refined powers from the plants, with many crates and bowls filled with the precious substance. A river runs past the greenhouse, while a small pond further in the complex grows water plants. There are storage rooms, three bedrooms, two living areas and an office.

Adventure Seed

The new owners of this building have hired you to remove the dangerous plants within by whatever means necessary. The last owner was a master alchemist and since he died no-one can enter safely.
When you arrive a thin man with spectacles is trying to climb the fence. He falls upon noticing you but declares that he wasn’t trying to sneak in. Then he sighs and admits that he used to be the old alchemist’s assistant. He hasn’t been allowed inside since the man passed, but after he learned the new owners want the plants destroyed he’s determined to save one of each species.
WHAT’S HAPPENING? The assistant was only allowed to help prepare the potions, and needs his master’s diary to learn how to safely repot the plants. If you help, he’ll give you free potions every blue moon at his shop. The more plants you save, the more different potions he can make.
The diary is located in his master’s office and explains how to handle five of the plant species. The first has prickly yellow-red flowers and needs to be sung to sleep with orcish throat chanting before it can be repotted. If you fail, it and the others of its species will emit a dangerous high-pitched screech.
The second is a green, leafy vine with small yellow blossoms. To replant it, you need to assert your dominance by winning a wrestling match with it. If you succeed, it will allow you—and only you—to handle and repot it. If you fail, the vines will attempt to strangle you to death.
The third is located in the pond. It is capable of walking from swamp to swamp, and thus can repot itself—but you’ll need to talk to it seductively to convince it to move. If you fail, it and its sister plants will shoot seeds at you which will embed themselves and cause an itchy rash.
The fourth is a small tree with pods of large, red seeds. It can’t be moved without dying, but you can take its seeds by dealing precise fire damage. This causes them to open up into small sprite-shapes with cries of “yippee,” “yay,” and “wooo” as they spiral down to plant themselves in nearby soil. However, if you use too much fire the tree will explode and shoot shrapnel from the pods.
The last plant has a large blue flower and needs to be scared enough to faint, but is only afraid of Lizardfolk. The alchemist left a mask of one in the storage shed, which you can wear before surprising it. If you fail, the plant will emit pollen causing uncontrollable, painfully breathtaking laughter.

boardgame.name: Haunted Bandit's Compound
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Located within a dingy city, this haunted bandit’s compound is filled with weapons, hammocks, and stolen goods. Tall spiked fences surround it and on the inside sharpened stakes have been placed as fortifications.
The central living area, behind an also-fortified courtyard, is filled with storage crates and barrels, more hammocks, as well as a giant bonfire. Rubble piles up in corners, and much of the leftover furniture within the building is cracked or broken. Dust gathers thickly, alongside giant cobwebs.
Another room contains powders, lackluster and covered with cobwebs. Small knives and other weapons are scattered throughout the complex. In a second courtyard there is a small bridge crossing over a pond, while outside the compound a cliff drops off into darkness on one side.

boardgame.name: Dark Elves Greenhouse Laboratory
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Located deep underground, this greenhouse laboratory run by dark elves is filled with glowing mushrooms and poisonous plants. A spider statue greets newcomers in the courtyard, past two small offices with living areas attached.
Alchemical preparation tables stand laden in the main growing room, while storage barrels and bottles of potions wait further in. Elsewhere, four prison cells wait, while an adjacent room is stained with blood from dissected bodies.
Yet another room is solely dedicated to refined powers from the plants, with many crates and bowls filled with the precious substances.

boardgame.name: Haunted Alchemist's Greenhouse Laboratory
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Located within a dingy city, this haunted alchemist’s greenhouse laboratory is filled with dead plants and forgotten things. Tall spiked fences surround it, and it looks as though no-one has been inside for years.
Alchemical preparation tables wait, still laden with equipment, inside the withered greenhouse. Further in storage barrels and bottles of potions gather dust. Yet another room contains abandoned refined powders, lackluster and covered with cobwebs.
A dark cliff waits past the greenhouse, and a small grey pond waits further in. There are storage rooms, three bedrooms, two living areas and an office—all of them left like the people who lived there intended to return…

boardgame.name: Ruined Temple of the Shark Priests
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Deep under the ocean waits the ruined temple of the shark priests. At its entrance is a statue of a shark, surrounded by robed figures holding bowls for offerings. There are chambers where priests and acolytes once lived, and scattered bones further in the temple.
Coral and seaweed grow on the sandy ground and from the stone walls. At the heart of the underwater temple waits a deep chasm, descending into darkness. Hanging above it are metal cages, while nearby rooms are filled with sarcophagi. Another room has four shackles where something once was held prisoner, but no longer…

boardgame.name: Snowy Alchemist's Greenhouse Laboratory
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Located within a frozen city, this snowy alchemist’s greenhouse laboratory grows luscious plants despite the cold. Tall spiked fences surround it, protecting its valuable contents from trespassers. Alchemical preparation tables stand laden in the greenhouse, while storage barrels and bottles of potions wait further in.
Yet another room is solely dedicated to refined powers from the plants, with many crates and bowls filled with the precious substances. A frozen solid river curves past the greenhouse, and an ice pond further inside the complex waits for spring. There are storage rooms, three bedrooms, two living areas and an office.

boardgame.name: Underdark Bandit's Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Located deep underground, this bandit’s lair is filled with glowing mushrooms, stolen goods, hammocks, weapons, and some cells. Sharpened stakes have been placed as fortifications throughout, and giant glowing mushrooms grow off some of the walls.
The central living area is filled with storage crates and barrels, more hammocks, as well as a giant bonfire. Rubble piles up in corners, and much of the leftover furniture within the lair is cracked or broken. Dust gathers thickly, alongside giant cobwebs.
Another room contains powders, lackluster and covered with cobwebs. Small knives and other weapons are scattered throughout the complex. In a second courtyard there is a small bridge crossing over a chasm.

boardgame.name: Izumi's Winter Japanese Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Japanese village is dusted with snow and surrounded by a frozen river and lake. A pink cherry blossom tree stands tall on a stony overcrop above the village, and below it is a bustling market lit by orange lanterns. Fabric stalls sell goods, while nearby stacks of barrels and crates store long-term supplies.
Bamboo trees and wildflowers clump throughout the village, and a bonfire lights up its heart. The village extends beyond the fenced off sections across the river, as well as to a larger structure in the center of a lake.

Adventure Seed

You arrive at a lively winter festival. Hot food skewers are sold alongside candied fruit and cups of warm sake. Loud music wafts through the air while children run underfoot giggling and throwing snowballs. Then you hear screaming from above. When you arrive at the source, you find a frozen man beneath the cherry blossom tree and an old woman in distress.
It looks like he froze to death but if the body is investigated you’ll find he died from hitting his head on a rock, as well as evidence of a struggle. His only possessions are jewellers equipment, plus a small white daffodil in his front pocket. No-one recognizes him—strangers travel into the village for the festival, but they believe his death is a dire omen.
Later that night, a blizzard rolls down from the mountains and you’re invited to shelter in a family’s home. The next morning a peasant boy and his alcoholic father are dead—frozen solid in their hovel of a shelter, near the still-warm embers of a fire…
WHAT’S HAPPENING? The first dead man, with the daffodil, had a wife who is a yuki-onna; a winter-spirit. She looks like a beautiful young woman with long black hair, blue lips, and pale, nearly transparent skin. She leaves no footprints, and when threatened can transform into a cloud of mist or snow. Her breath can freeze, but she can’t tolerate hot water.
Her husband had journeyed down from their mountain cabin, as he did every few years, to sell the gems he cuts. This time he was killed and robbed by three street urchins, who stole his gems and now keep them on their persons. After learning of his death, she returned with a blizzard and froze one murderer and the man with him. She will continue nightly until they are all dead.
The robbers are street children without homes, though one was a teenager caring for his abusive alcoholic father. The group didn’t mean to kill the jeweller, but when he realized one of them was pickpocketing he grew angry and they panicked. He was pushed over as they escaped and hit his head on a rock, killing him.
The thieves eat scraps and have been struggling to survive for months, but they will die soon if the yuki-onna isn’t stopped. If you figure out what’s happening in time and are persuasive, you might be able to remind her of her love for her own children and beg her to show mercy. Otherwise, you could trick her into believing the murderers are dead by returning the gems.

boardgame.name: Uzaku's Beach Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Eastern beach village is bordered by a waterfall and the open sea. A circle of overgrown mossy rocks stands tall on a stony overcrop above the village, and below it is a bustling market lit by orange lanterns. Fabric stalls sell goods, while nearby stacks of barrels and crates store long-term supplies.
Bamboo trees and flowering vines clump throughout the village, alongside broad leafy undergrowth. A bonfire lights up its heart from a central stone chamber.
The village extends beyond a thick fence, across the river, and into a thick forest filled with palm trees. There is a small pier that allows for docking ships.

boardgame.name: Underdark Trade Town
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This underdark trade town is bordered by a waterfall and a pit of unfathomable darkness. A purple blossoming tree stands on a stony overcrop above the village, and below it is a bustling market lit by orange lanterns. Fabric stalls sell goods, while nearby stacks of barrels and crates store long-term supplies.
Purple and red fungi grow throughout the village and down the sides of the cliffs.

boardgame.name: Firebloom Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Eastern village is bordered by a burning river of lava, feeding a crimson lake. Embers rise past charred stone, while metal bars reinforce unstable stone cliffs around which the town has been built.
A firebloom tree stands tall on a stony overcrop above the village, and below it is a bustling market lit by pale yellow lanterns. Fabric stalls sell goods, while nearby stacks of singed barrels and crates store long-term supplies.
A bonfire lights up the village’s heart, while further on the houses extend past a blackened bridge to another stone island.

boardgame.name: Izumi's Japanese Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Japanese village is bordered by a river and a lake. A pink cherry blossom tree stands tall on a stony overcrop above the village, and below it is a bustling market lit by orange lanterns. Fabric stalls sell goods, while nearby stacks of barrels and crates store long-term supplies.
Bamboo trees and flowering vines clump throughout the village, and a bonfire lights up its heart. The village extends beyond the fenced off sections across the river, as well as to a larger structure in the centre of a lake.

boardgame.name: Giant's Underdark Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Glowing fungi cling to the walls of this Underdark giant’s lair. A bearskin on loose hay forms a bed, while a central cooking fire is decorated with engraved mammoth tusks and bones from prior meals.
A network of caverns, fortified with sharpened stakes and burning torches, forms this lair. Running through it is a green stream, while stone bridges span high above the deep gouge it has made through the stone.

Adventure Seed

A gnome woman has offered you a reward if you kill an evil, ugly giantess called Lady Daarina. The gnome says she has bewitched many men into serving as her slaves, and she hasn’t had any contact with any of them for weeks.
At the entrance to the lair is a two-headed lizard the size of a human. It is covered with pustules, and has too many eyes on its heads. If it sees you it will start “barking” and approach. If you kill it, closer inspection may reveal a collar around its neck reading “Scamander”.

When you reach the lair itself you find male gnomes washing pots and pans down by the stream, while others are catching fish or collecting fungi. Overlooking them is a gorgeous giantess in a white dress, with long greying hair. A choker of purple gemstones glows around her neck.

If you’ve killed the lizard she will see that you’re covered in blood and notice her pet’s not barking. She will furiously demand you leave immediately due to killing Scamander. The adoring gnomes will accuse you of being a monster. If you try to rebut them with how hideous the lizard was, they’ll exclaim that he had a skin condition. If confronted about bewitching the gnomes she’ll emphatically deny it.

WHAT’S HAPPENING? While it might look like the gnomes are spellbound, the giantess really is a beautiful, wholesome old woman who appreciates the company and help. In return she cooks the gnomes tasty food, provides emotional support, and massages their sore muscles.

If you kill her and bring her necklace to a jeweller to see if it’s magical, you will learn that it’s just a normal necklace—the glowing is innate in the stones. The gnome men, still adoring, will loathe you for killing their sweet Lady and demand you never return.

The woman who sent you to kill the giantess was disbelieving that all the young men in her village prefer to spend time with Lady Daariana rather than her or the other women. She convinced herself that the giantess must be an evil monster deceiving them.

boardgame.name: Fire Giant's Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A stream of lava flows through the center of this fire giant’s lair. Embers rise up past charred stone cliffs, while thin stone bridges cross high above. Further in, a bearskin on loose hay forms a bed. At the center of the lair a cooking fire is decorated with engraved mammoth tusks and bones from prior meals.
A network of caverns, fortified with sharpened stakes and burning torches, forms this lair. There are plenty of places the giant can see you approach, before you see it…

boardgame.name: Ice Giant's Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Walls of ice form this giant’s lair. A bearskin on loose hay makes a bed over the cold ice floor. Nearby, a central cooking fire is decorated with engraved mammoth tusks and bones from prior meals.
A network of crystalline caverns, fortified with sharpened stakes and burning torches, forms this frozen lair. Running through it is a stream, while slippery ice bridges span high above.

boardgame.name: Forest Giant's Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A stream of water sparkles through the center of this forest giant’s lair. It has gouged a deep path through the stone, forming cliffs bridged by stone high above. Bushes and wildflowers line the stone walkways.
Further in, a bearskin on loose hay forms a bed. At the center of the lair a cooking fire is decorated with engraved mammoth tusks and bones from prior meals. It is a network of caverns, fortified with sharpened stakes and burning torches, which forms this lair.
Beyond the entrance is a luscious, green forest.

boardgame.name: Underdark River Caverns
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Glowing fungi cling to the walls of this Underdark lair, which is formed of a network of caverns. Running through it is a green stream, while stone bridges span high above the deep gouge it has made through the stone.

boardgame.name: Overgrown River Cavern
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A stream of water sparkles through the center of this overgrown river cavern. It has gouged a deep path through the stone, forming cliffs bridged by stone high above. Bushes and wildflowers line the stone walkways.
Beyond the entrance is a luscious, green forest.

boardgame.name: Emojo Dojo
boardgame.description:
A great new spin on the classic card game, "War". Martial Art Emoji themed, multi-player all out war with special battle cards and situations. Ten different Emoji's from white belt to black belt battle it out along with the wise Sensei.

Up to five players battle it out to win the battle cards. The last person standing in the 'dojo' is the winner. There are three types of "FACE-OFF" cards; Standard, Roundhouse and Tag-team, each keeps the battles interesting. Several special circumstances such as:
Double Trouble: Separate battles take place at the same time.
Lucky Strike: All cards in consecutive order (4,5,6,7), lowest card wins.
Loco Mojo: All players advance to the next level battle.
Go!-Low: Two cards are the same rank but lower than the highest card (3,3,10), The high card has the option to surrender or join in the battle. These make each hand dynamic and exciting.

Emojo Dojo has three levels of play; Sly's Battle (Easy), Basic Play and Sensei Rules (complex).

The thing everyone hates about WAR is watching two people exchange cards for hours. Emojo Dojo has "Elimination Rules" that reveals a quick winner as the players get knocked out. This keeps games quick and everyone interested and engaged.

boardgame.name: Cheddar Blitz
boardgame.description:
Fast-paced racing game! All players race at the same time to complete five unique Challenges. Players scramble to match their BLiTZ Row to their Challenge cards while preventing others to match theirs. Special "FLiP OUT" cards forces any player to swap out their current Challenge card and start over.

Each player starts with 5 challenge cards (top one face up), two round BLiTZ cards in their hand and four face up on the table. There are 2 draw piles and a discard area. Play begins when the dealer says "Blitz". The play action is DRAW, DISCARD, DOWN. Players (simultaneously, not taking turns) draw a round Blitz card, then discards (face up) a card that they don't need. This card becomes available for other players. Then places one down from their hand to fill in the row. When a player matches their BLiTZ row to their Challenge card, they yell "CHEDDAR" and all play pauses while they reset the board and turn over a new challenge card.
You can use any number of wild cards and can rearrange your row at any time. The winner is the one who completes all five Challenges and Shouts "CHEDDAR!"

Unique colorful round BLiTZ cards highlights the special Emoji on each card.

boardgame.name: Old Bill
boardgame.description:
Build a den of thieves with matching pairs, but avoid Old Bill by outwitting and outwitting the other Masterminds! The player who gets the most matching pairs of thieves (two cards with the same picture) wins the game, but watch out for Old Bill! If you end up with him in your hand, he will remove one of your matches!

Players draw cards and either play or trade them to make matches. Old Bill will reduce some of your matches.

The game continues until a player takes the last card from the deck. This is now the last round, in which each player makes a final move.

Players now count the number of pairs they have managed to make in their area for the score. If a player ends up with any number of old bills in their hand, they must discard one of their scoring pairs. The player with the most pairs of thieves wins the game! If there is a tie, add up the ranks across your paired pairs, counting the pair's rank only once, not both Thieves within a pair. Whoever has the highest total score wins! If there is still a tie, the win is split.

You can also pull this box out for a classic game of Old Maid (with ole' Bill) or Memory with the whole family.

– description from the publisher

boardgame.name: What Lies Below: The RPG Metal Opera
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Are you ready for Metal?

For fans of heavy metal and fantasy RPGs, comes What Lies Below, the RPG Metal Opera, a "metallized" version of the current edition of the world's most popular RPG.

This Player's Guide features eight new classes (Cultist, Hellion, High Sorcerer, Jack, Madaxe, Shifter, Slayer, & Trooper) along with feats, equipment, and spells inspired by classic metal songs and bands. Includes a custom alignment system and sub-skills. Power points and spell points fuel spells and class features rather than per rest useage or spell slots.

So grab your dice and fire up the tunes! It's time for the RPG Metal Opera to begin.

boardgame.name: Night Blade
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The city streets of Otrista are a playground to shadows and all that hide within them. Nothing is sacred on these cobbled streets, not even priests who must walk them. A worshiper of Matalik, the ‘Ashen Curse’, fell victim to these shadows, and now finds sport in this abyssal filth as retribution. He releases a vengeful slayer, one who is uncaring and unwavering in its purpose to spill blood, regardless of whom it encounters.

Night Blade is a combat encounter, ranging from 'medium' to 'hard' in difficulty for four to six players and is scalable, starting at 2nd level.

boardgame.name: Carcass Crawler (Issue #1 - Aug 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first issue of Carcass Crawler — the official Old-School Essentials zine! Each issue is packed with new material for your games, including new character classes and races, new spells and magic items, new monsters, optional and expanded rules, news, previews of in-development products, short adventures, and more!

In This Issue

New classes: Six new character classes! The acolyte, the gargantua, the goblin, the hephaestan, the kineticist, and the mage.
New races: Three new character races for Advanced Fantasy games! The gargantua, the goblin, and the hephaestan.
Black powder weapons: Complete rules for introducing renaissance-style black powder firearms into your game!
Fighter combat talents: Optional rules to give fighters a little extra mechanical perk.
d6 thief skills: An optional alternative system for thief skills.
Adjudicating thief skills: Optional guidelines for adjudicating the use of thief skills and attempts by other characters to perform similar tasks.

boardgame.name: Desolation of the God-King
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stranger in a strange land! Sorcery has pulled you from your familiar homeland to a desolate place. Lost and far from home, can you survive the deadly hazards of the desert and the trap filled tombs to return to Albion?

This solo adventure includes material based on the Dragon Warriors setting.

boardgame.name: 100 Fantasy Biomes 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides a hundred different locations for a big fantasy map. Included in each entry is name of location (which indicates biome/location type) as well as a descriptor that could be a lead in for an interesting encounter, adventure hook, source of treasure, community to visit, etc.

boardgame.name: 100 Fantasy Biomes 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides a hundred different locations for a big fantasy map. Included in each entry is name of location (which indicates biome/location type) as well as a descriptor that could be a lead in for an interesting encounter, adventure hook, source of treasure, community to visit, etc.

boardgame.name: Woodrum's Curious Collection of Village Map Details
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So you’ve got a village map… now what?

Its a dilemma that only a Game Master (GM) with writer’s block or a lack of time can fully appreciate. You’ve drawn up a village map, downloaded one from an online generator, or bought a ready to use one via pdf. However, once you start to write up the details of the map you suddenly find that you don’t have the time, energy, or inspiration to describe every location. Not a problem, right? Wrong! You’ve got a group of really nosy players, the kind that want to know everything about every little place. You’re next gaming session is two days away and the characters have to make a stop in town to gather up supplies and some clues about their next adventure. So what are you going to do now?

Don’t freak out. We’ve got the solution.
Woodrum’s Curious Collection Of Village Map Details is an exhaustive list of 100 different fleshed out localities. How does this product help you? Simple. You provide the map and we provide the details. Whenever a player stumbles on a location in the village/town/city that they want to know more about you simply roll the percentile die and consult the corresponding numbered information. Don’t like using the dice or dealing with awkward random results? You can simply choose a preferred entry on your own instead.
Want to prep a bit more before hand or keep track of what random rolls connect to what area on the map? We’ve got you covered on that as well. The author has thoughtfully included a blank form that allows you to enter the number of the map’s building and the location details that you’ve rolled up/chosen for the location.
For example: Let’s say the characters stumble across building number 348 on that huge fantasy city map. You roll the dice and come up with location details 14. You will enter 348 on the map number column and 14 (with some brief info.) on the location details column.

boardgame.name: 50 Fantasy Gang Thugs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides 50 different brutes, criminals, and scoundrels that are perfect for fleshing out the gangs of fantasy urban areas. Included in each entry is the thug’s name, gender, brief descriptive, specialty (robbing, gambling, extortion, fighting, etc.), and weapon(s).

boardgame.name: 50 Most Curious Books
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 50 different books to fill the shelves of a fantasy campaign library. Some hint at magical research value while others cover a variety of other topics. Included in each entry is the following: Title of book, author, page count, binding type, condition that the book is in when found, and the overall market value of the book (in current condition) listed in gold coins.

boardgame.name: 50 Most Curious Books 2
boardgame.description:

boardgame.name: Trouble on Jackral V
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When Sovereign Liberation Front operatives awaken a powerful artificial intelligence, the team is caught between two opposing factions. The scrappers must decide whom to support and determine the fate of that powerful AI.

Trouble on Jackral V is a One-Sheet Scenario designed for use with Shadows Over Sol: Science Fiction Horror Roleplaying and the Jovian Whispers campaign and sourcebook.

boardgame.name: 50 Visitors of the Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides 50 different travelers that you might find visiting a fantasy hamlet, village, town, or city. Some folk are innocent and seeking to do business while others are guilty of crimes or fleeing an undesirable situation. Each listing provides the visitor’s name (typically first name and surname), gender, a role/occupation/class, a brief general description, and a bit of a background story.

Each listing provides the visitor’s name (typically first name and surname), gender, a role/occupation/class, a brief general description, and a bit of a background story.

boardgame.name: 50 Space Port Gang Thugs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Skulking about the filthy alleyways, abandoned dwellings, and dark corners of space port docking zones are a collection of local thugs and gang members. This product provides 50 different thugs for the GM to fill up the ranks of the gangs that infest their seedy space port cities.

Each entry includes the thug’s name, a general description, a specialty that they are known for, and weapon(s) that they carry on their person.

boardgame.name: 50 Space Port Gang Thugs 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Skulking about the filthy alleyways, abandoned dwellings, and dark corners of space port docking zones are a collection of local thugs and gang members. This product provides 50 different thugs for the GM to fill up the ranks of the gangs that infest their seedy space port cities.

Each entry includes the thug’s name, a general description, a specialty that they are known for, and weapon(s) that they carry on their person.

boardgame.name: 100 Critters for Alien Biomes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This product offers a collection of 100 critters to populate your alien biomes with. Some creatures may be worthy of giving additional game stats while others are small, defenseless, and make for good background details or other game effects (chewing wires, producing toxic spray, etc.). Included in each entry is the critter’s name, general creature type (rodent, nocturnal lizard, etc.), and an additional descriptive (communication, use in galactic trade, etc.)

boardgame.name: Champions!
boardgame.description:
Let the Tournament begin! You and an opposing commander shall face off in a battle of wits for the prestigious title of Royal Commander!

In Champions!, two players will take turns upgrading and commanding legions of warriors to defeat their opponent in battle.

The game is played on an imagined 6 row by 3 column board, with either player picking one of the far back rows as their base row.

Each turn has two phases:
1. Movement: you will move your units around the board (rotate, move, fight). Cards move one space per turn.
2. Reinforce: you will summon a new scout or upgrade a scout to a champion (recruit, upgrade).

You win the battle, and the title of Royal General, if you move one of your units into your opponent’s base row.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

boardgame.name: 100 Plants for Alien Biomes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So you’ve got a whole bunch of our alien biome lists and you’ve plotted out the territories on those planetary maps. Now that the characters have landed...what kind of surrounding flora do they see? This list contains 100 different types of flora (fungi as well as plants) that you can drop into your biomes. Some plants/fungus are biome specific while others are more universal. Some have useful in game effects while others are more useful for trade or are just interesting.

boardgame.name: 100 Plants for Alien Biomes 2
boardgame.description:

boardgame.name: 100 Spaceport Robots V19.0
boardgame.description:

This list provides 100 different robots that the characters might encounter while visiting a busy spaceport. Included is the robot's "name", role/function, and a brief descriptive.

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 37
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: Stacks
boardgame.description:
Bluffing, to a science.
Stacks is a 15-card, 3-4 player bluffing game where the stakes are high and they keep raising.

Overview
Play cards each turn to increase the point value of your Stack. Make a bid that matches the value of all the cards in your Stack. Keep raising the Bid each turn to stay in the round. Get caught lying, and your opponent takes everything. Beware the dastardly -10 card, or use it yourself to catch your opponents by surprise.

Each round of Stacks is about a minute long, from dealing the cards to scoring the points. Play a few rounds at lunch or a few hundred.

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 38
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: Chromatic Transference
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Chromatic Transference is the fourth Mothership Pamphlet Module. It's formatted like a double sided tri-fold brochure and contains all the information you need to play an excellent one-shot.

The top secret Ukweli-4 research facility was built to study a strange meteorite, inside of which is a color never before seen by human eyes. Due to an accident, the original researchers have long since died, leaving the facility an empty tomb.

Written by Reece Carter it includes:

A fully playable, ready-to-run one shot to drop in to any sci-fi RPG campaign.
A spooky crawl through an abandoned laboratory.
A map, key, and player handouts to make running this an absolute breeze.


This adventure is suitable for characters of any level in a survival horror setting and is sure to pose a challenge to even the most battle hardened party.

boardgame.name: Aves
boardgame.description:
In Aves (Spanish for “Birds”), players take on the roles of hungry birds. Seek out the best grubs to score points and gain special powers. Outwit your opponents and rule the skies!

The goal of Aves is to score the most points by eating grubs.
At the end of the game, the player with the highest score wins!

Players draw cards to move, eat grubs, collect bonus points, and affect others players moves.

The game ends the moment the Grubs deck runs out.

All players count up their points as well as bonus points from set bonuses or special rules. The player with the highest score wins! If there is a tie, the player who ate the most Grubs wins.

boardgame.name: Panama
boardgame.description:
Our fleet’s halfway around the world. It’ll be smooth sailing once we’re through the famously crowded Panama Canal. But another famous Captain has accidentally been scheduled for the same day!

In Panama, you must use your fleet’s special abilities to push your ships through the Panama Canal before your opponent!

Each player controls a fleet of 9 ships. Each ship has a special power that makes it unique. On your turn, pick one of your ships and move it one space per your ship's special abilities.

To win, move six of your nine ships through the Panama canal, past all of your opponent’s ships, and off the opposite end of the board, past all of your opponent’s ships.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

boardgame.name: Pandemic Poker
Pandemiepoker
boardgame.description:
In the humorous and instructive card game Pandemic Poker, everyone wants to protect themselves from the infectious viruses. Mouth and nose protection or disinfectants will benefit you and a few rolls of toilet paper can also help you out.

It is important to keep your distance, also with regard to the playing cards: the cards have different values ​​and may only be placed on the discard pile with a certain (number) distance. Each card has an additional function that can have an advantage or disadvantage for you or your fellow players. Whoever manages to discard all of his hand cards wins the game.

Pandemic Poker is Uno with distance rules and strange special abilities. No cards that are directly adjacent to it are placed on the stack, only those values ​​may be placed that are indicated as permitted on the previous card. After all, we have to keep our distance. In addition, there are special cards that I can play at any time if I have two of the same type. So I suspend or draw cards. Alternatively, I also get rid of CoVid19 cards or swap cards in my hand. And speaking of CoVid19 cards. If we have three of them in hand, we are eliminated from the game. Whoever gets rid of all of his hand cards first wins.

boardgame.name: Ducks Left Wanting (to be left alone)
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A herd of ducks aimlessly wander a dungeon hallway. Items of use or value tied round their necks. But catching ducks ALWAYS comes with a cost.

boardgame.name: Kreuz-Mühle
boardgame.description:
Each player has 12 playing pieces of one color. In the first stage of the game players take turns placing their pieces on the intersections of the board, attempting to make a connected line of three inside one of the five squares on the board. A line with pieces in more than one square doesn't count. Once all the pieces have been placed, the players may slide them. Whenever a player makes a line of three, he removes an opponent's piece of his choice, which is not part of a line of three. When one player has only three pieces left, he is allowed to move any piece from any point on the board to any other point. As soon as one player is left with only two pieces, his opponent wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Tales from the Red Dragon Inn
boardgame.description:
Put down your flagons and strap on your swords, it’s time to delve through some dungeons in Tales from the Red Dragon Inn! A new 1-4 player cooperative board game by SlugFest Games!

In Tales you will take on the role of one of the famous characters from The Red Dragon Inn series of games as they tackle their day job of being big damn heroes. The multi-scenario campaign pits the players against game-controlled enemies tailor-made for each illustrated fold-out game map. Each scenario will take you to a new map, with new foes and even a few tricky puzzles to solve. You'll need to work together with the other players by equipping hero and item cards to support your allies who have their own unique abilities and roles.

Each scenario has specific objectives, so how you and your party beat each one varies from "kill all the enemies" to "survive X turns" to "protect this thing until something happens" to "get to this room on the map". All of the players win the scenario together by completing that scenario's final objective. They can also all lose together if any one of them are defeated in combat, or in the case of many scenarios, the enemies complete their own AI-controlled objective.

boardgame.name: Crazy Golf
boardgame.description:
Cards are lined up to create mini-golf holes, players will roll dice to try and achieve the lowest score. There are different routes to each hole - which route to take is up to the player. The player will call out which route they intend on taking, then roll dice to determine whether or not the conditions are met for them to continue along that path.

Holes consist of 4-6 cards lined up, with difficulty differences depending on which side of the card is used.

The game is a mix between dice rolling, risk vs reward, and mini-golf.

boardgame.name: Crowded Kitchen
boardgame.description:
Race your opponents in this lightning fast, real time, set collection card game. Fight over limited ingredients in the Kitchen. Organize your cook space. Plan ahead by storing ingredients in your Pantry. Compete against other chefs to complete recipes as fast as you can and earn the prestigious Excellence Stars.

There are no turns. All players play at the same time.

Players attempt to complete Recipe cards as quickly as possible using Ingredients taken from the Kitchen. Each player has their own deck of recipes, but the ingredients in the Kitchen are shared. When players complete a Recipe, they set that recipe card along with any ingredients used to complete it aside in a completed pile. Players then reveal a new recipe from their deck.

When a player has no cards left to draw from their Recipe deck, the round ends. Players score one point for each completed Recipe and Ingredient used to complete those recipes (ignoring Sketchy Substitutes). The player with the most points, wins the round and earns a star card. Each star earned increases the difficulty for that player in future rounds by limiting the number of recipes they can have active. The first player to collect the required amount of stars, wins.

boardgame.name: Beacon Hill RPG Encounter Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Beacon Hill - RPG Encounter Map

Someone has lit the eponymous pyre upon Beacon Hill, has an invasion begun!

This tiny rural settlement lies at the foot of a large hill with a beacon fire at its summit and makes up part of the early warning system for the kingdom to warn of invaders and other dangers.

The largest cottage is home to the Pyre Warden, a low ranking official responsible for always maintaining the readiness of the beacon fire and for ensuring it's lit as soon as a smoke plume from the next beacon in the chain can be seen.

Battle map is 24x36 and has grid/no grid versions in both print (300DPI) and VTT (140dpi) formats.

The Wilderness Books of Battle Mats - Digital Edition
The wilderness extends to the horizon, filling your senses with anticipation and excitement.

This unforgiving land is home to terrors and treasures in equal measure for those bold enough to explore its ranges. From the sprawling grassy hills right up to the snowy peaks, this land covers vast distances and many challenging environments with a climate of adventure. Will the party be equal to this wild world?

The Wilderness Books of Battle Mats (Digital Edition) is a bundle of battle map tiles to create wild fantasy environments.

Included in this Title:

120 WildernessFantasy Battle Map Tiles
5E Adventure Module: The Stolen Song

boardgame.name: ゆるキャン△〜どこでもテント張り！(Yurucamp Tents Everywhere!)
boardgame.description:
In this 1-4 player game based on the hit manga "laid-back camp", you want to get your tents all set up and ready for camping!

In gameplay terms, this means players lay out a pyramid of 28 cards (one card at a time) from a deck of 36 cards (4x each of 0-8) by using math to make sure that every card can be played correctly. that is, each card played in the pyramid must either be the sum or the difference between the two cards below it (playing a 8 or 2 if they respectively are more than 8 or less than 0).

Players win the game when one one player can a play card or the team cooperatively creates a 7 layer pyramid.

boardgame.name: The Game オバケやしきのすうじのアクマ (Demons of Numbers)
boardgame.description:
THE GAME オバケやしきのすうじのアクマ is a new incarnation of The Game where players struggle to seal away ghosts and other creatures lurking about a haunted mansion.  

The premise of the game is that players are naughty children who enter a haunted house and accidentally open a book that releases a host of demons. They must work to seal these escapees back into the book. However, the demons are actually Demons of Numbers and therefore the players cannot speak in numbers (or else be cursed and die).

The basic gameplay is the same as The Game, where players work together to discard all cards into four piles depending on the UP/DOWN conditions of each pile. During their turn, players discard either a larger or smaller value card(s) as appropriate. Afterwards, players refill their hand.  

Players cannot share the numbers of the cards in their hand with other players but must find ways to collaborate in order to effectively place cards in the four piles so that all players can have zero cards in their hand at the end of the game.

If there is an exact difference of 10 between the card a player discards and the last card in a pile, the player is free to play the card regardless of the UP/DOWN direction of the pile.  

In Demons of Numbers, there are also six types of effect cards (which are number cards with an effect written at the bottom): Reverse, Skip, Short, Draw 2, Silence, and Declaration of Death.

There are three types of ending results for the game: Total victory, victory, and loss.

--

Additional Information:

This all new game builds upon the original The Game with additional rules for a spookishly fresh gameplay experience.

Unlike The Game Extreme which added rules to make gameplay even more challenging for players, Demons of Numbers offers a more interactive, conversational experience. The new design also allows for up to 6 players.

Familiar “effects” are added to the game to give it a more UNO-esque familiarity. In fact, these changes have earned this version of the game the nickname “The Game Junior” by the original publisher.

The increased player number, new rules, and random events make it more difficult for players to find a repeatable pattern to beat the game and result in a making Demons of Numbers more of a “party game” for all ages and for gamers and non-gamers alike.

The designer, 326, felt that the original The Game had a title that was really not ideally optimized for easy internet searches, as well as artwork that would make it for children to convince their parents to purchase the game for them. He wanted to take a new approach and was able to find a willing partner in Arclight Games.

Illustrations are also by 326.

boardgame.name: Cranky Chinchillas
boardgame.description:
Cranky Chinchillas is a cute and mischievous game of secret alliances, betrayal, and destruction.

Players start the game secretly divided into teams with different objectives. Bluff, plot, team up, and backstab other players to survive while you figure out which side everybody is on. Then unleash destruction and sweet revenge on your enemies with the help of your fluffy, round heroes! But watch out – at least one of your “friends” could be The Deceiver, allowing them to betray everyone and claim solo victory!

The first person or team to achieve their victory condition wins the game!

boardgame.name: Edge of Darkness: Emissaries of the Vale
boardgame.description:
The new expansion to Edge of Darkness sees the Mystic Vale and guilds of Aegis team up to battle the blight. It adds a new Druidic magic mechanic, which is at center stage in this expansion. The expansion also adds new player options for already running Edge of Darkness.

Contents: 12 unique vale locations, 12 new contracts & threats, 12 Gaia's Blessing Tokens, and 20 growth tokens. Also comes with the Desolation Micro expansion (1 location cards, 2 associated contract and threat cards - 8 cards in total)

boardgame.name: Minigolf Designer: Putt of No Return Expansion
boardgame.description:
This is a mini expansion for Minigolf Designer and requires the base game to play. Inside, you will find 5 double layered score sheets to replace the original ones and new gameplay additions: 4 new clients (two women and two men) to renew the client whim flavor and 24 new tiles, including tricky tiles with 3 red and 1 green edge.

Here are how the new clients score:
- Mrs Noreturn likes directional tiles (the tiles with a white arrow). Before, these tiles were just penalizing you if you placed them in the wrong direction, now Mrs Noreturn will actually reward you for each arrow in the right direction.
- Mr Intheway gives points for a tile feature that was not exploited yet in the game: obstacles.
- Mrs Camper likes the grass tiles, which will be perfect if you chose her with Mr Short, but will be more challenging with Mr Long.
- Mr Perfect will satisfy perfectionist players, as he gives you points for each perfectly respected constraint (3 victory points for playability, 4 for the land constraint, 5 for the circuit constraint, and 6 for the par constraint).

-- Publisher description

boardgame.name: Titles
boardgame.description:
Titles is a movie-themed atmosphere and general culture game in which you will have to guess a movie title from a card.

At the start of the game, each player draws 5 cards and 1 other card is put in the center. On your turn, you had to choose between "play 1 of your cards then pick a new one" or "discard 1 to 5 cards and draw as much".

The game ends, when a player reaches 30 points. At the end of the game, we end the round so that everyone has played the same number of times, and the one with the most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Suits Me Dice Game
boardgame.description:
Suits Me is a dice game that is played with five custom suited dice: each die displaying the four standard card suits on the four side faces and 50 points displayed on the top and bottom faces.

Players have three dice rolls during each turn to accumulate as many points as possible, which are added to their total game score. Points are awarded for various suited combinations of dice rolled, plus additional points for each die rolled showing a number value. As the name of the game implies... suited dice rolls offer the most lucrative scoring opportunities and the first player to reach the target score wins the game.

boardgame.name: Into the Pit
boardgame.description: A fast-paced retro-FPS roguelite! As a member of a family of lore-hunting mystics you are summoned to a cursed village, drawn by rumors of a demonic portal. Dark magics have overwhelmed the village, It's up to you to rescue the survivors, grow your powers, and journey forth INTO THE PIT.

boardgame.name: Stray Blade
boardgame.description: Prove yourself in this action RPG and master intense combat while exploring the ancient ruins of a mysterious civilization. Legends tell of Acrea the Lost Valley, a wild and overgrown place but unmistakably powerful. You found this forgotten land yet died. Time passes, and miraculously you are brought back to life. The price you pay: You are bound to this land.

boardgame.name: Vile Bounty
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Dreams of the Red Wizards: Terminal Ambitions Adventure

Ships have gone missing in the Sea of Swords and
Queen Serissa wants to know why.

Part One of the Shadow Games series of adventures.

A Four-Hour Adventure or 5th through 10th-Level Characters.

Optimized for: APL 8
boardgame.rpgseries: DDAL - Dreams of the Red Wizards

boardgame.name: Mirror Image (Cepheus)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trouble Comes in Twos...

The Planet of Mire is expanding; new contracts for surveying and colonizing make it the ideal destination for any group of spacefarers looking to make their mark. While preparations are underway for a lucrative expedition, a group of contractors are set to enjoy an all-expenses paid stay at a premier luxury hotel in Mire’s capital city of Rosha Des. But events set in motion by unseen forces set them up with a night to remember...even if they’d prefer to forget...

Players will experience the surreal and bizarre as they navigate through emotional strain and moral conundrums in a hostile environment. With multiple endings and outcomes, they may decide the fates of those involved at The Menagerie. Will they discover the truth? Or remain blessed with ignorance?

Inside you will find:

A 25-page, fully illustrated, adventure compatible with the Cepheus Engine RPG.
A new planet, Mire, usable with most any setting.
A dangerous, mind-bending tale for 3-6 characters.
4-6 hours of gameplay, depending on playstyle.

boardgame.name: Betrayal on Bethic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The heroes’ business on the planet Bethic is interrupted by the shocking news that an acquaintance of theirs has been accused of taking part in the assassination of the planet’s leader. They soon discover the truth: their friend was duped into helping in the plot, and he asks the party to clear his name by delivering evidence of what actually happened. The travelers then find themselves in the crosshairs of a hidden foe dedicated to preventing them from delivering the evidence, and caught up in a plot that extends all the way into the local government, and beyond.

Betrayal on Bethic is a short adventure for 2D6 science fiction RPGs such as Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game.

boardgame.name: Template Races: Tieflings
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Template Races: Tiefling. Tieflings, also known as devilspawn or hellspawn, have become a staple of our fantasy roleplaying games. The concept of a mortal character with a fiendish ancestry is one that is popular with a lot of players. A lot of work has been put into providing a variety of fiendish heritages for tieflings. However, the tiefling’s mortal ancestry is almost always restricted to being human, or just hand waved away as “sure you can have an elf tiefling, but it is the fiendish part that is important”. Have you ever wanted to play an elf tiefling that is actually elfy?

That is where the tiefling race template comes in – it is a quick and relatively simple way to produce game rules for tiefling races that incorporate elements from the mortal race as well as their fiendish heritage. Here we present the tiefling race template and over a dozen examples of tiefling races. Use this race template to combine tiefling racial traits with the racial traits of the desired mortal race in a similar manner to applying a monster template to a monster stat block.

boardgame.name: Scales of War
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

AT MY SIGNAL, UNLEASH HELL!

The united forces of the Five Nations march into the Mournland to wage war on the Lord of Blades. West of the Glass Plateau, they're met by an army the likes of which hasn't been seen since the heights of the Last War. Let battle commence! Optimized for APL 18, this is the second in a quartet of adventures, the Flames of War storyline.

Welcome to the Oracle of War campaign, a new 20-part standalone story for the D&D Adventurers League! You can play this adventure as part of your own Eberron: Rising from the Last War campaign, or as part of the Oracle of War organized play campaign. While this campaign runs under the umbrella of the Adventurers League, it utilizes different rules. You can familiarize yourself with these unique campaign rules by checking out the Oracle of War Player's Guide and Oracle of War DM's Guide, found in the D&D Adventurers League Players Pack.

boardgame.name: Horror Beneath the Frost
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Sometimes the scariest things come from within

Avalanches are hardly news in Icewind Dale. The frequency to which it is occurring, however, defies logic. What is the cause of this strange phenomenon? What horrors could have unleashed such force of nature with such reckless abandon?

Horror Beneath the Frost is a slasher horror adventure set in Icewind Dale, deep within the Reghed Glacier. It features yetis, mind flayers and a boneclaw!
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Chwingatown
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A four hour Dungeoncraft adventure, set Icewind Dale, in the Eleventh Town: Chwingatown! It premiered at Redcap's Corner July 2021.

Hunters in Easthaven are bringing back stories of tiny armed humanoids that chant “CHWINGA CHWINGA!” while waving their weapons. Are they threatening the Ten-Towns?
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Southlands Worldbook for 5th Edition
boardgame.description:
A Vast Realm of Living Temples and Carnelian Tombs!

In the Southlands, the world is alive with elemental power and wondrous magic, ancient god-kings walk among the living, and empires at their height echo the mystery and majesty of the past. This campaign setting for the 5th Edition of the world's first RPG is ripe with possibilities for adventure in ancient tombs, enormous jungles, and searing deserts, where swift-flying sand ships dart between distant cities.

The sprawling Southlands include the legacy of jinn, the domains of gnolls, the ruins of minotaurs, the gifts of god-kings, and many more rich stories perfect for pulp adventure campaigns.

A glittering array of kingdoms to adventure in!
Two continental-sized poster maps
New divine domains, new monsters, and new Southlands equipment
Fully compatible with the 5th Edition ruleset
boardgame.rpgseries: Southlands: Adventures Beneath the Pitiless Sun

boardgame.name: Find & Seek Scavenger Hunt Card Game
boardgame.description: In this scavenger hunt game, players flip over cards and rush to find items that match the description on the card. There are 3 ways to play, but whoever finds the specified number of items first is the winner.

boardgame.name: What the Duck?
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Deep inside the Miserable Dungeon, Dücktor Doom is using his arcane knowledge to save the ducks who have fallen in battle. How does he create these abominations? What are they for? What purpose do they serve in the terrible duck god's cult?

boardgame.name: World of Paranoia
boardgame.description:
WORLD OF PARANOIA is a dystopian world that offers you the power to play the role of a supercomputer in the not too distant future.

RESEARCH NEW TECHNOLOGIES - Each new technology you research increases your chances of generating more resources, building new facilities, and controlling your citizens.

BUILD YOUR UTOPIA- As the game progresses, you can build new facilities in your futuristic complex.

Beware of TRAITORS! A citizen who is not happy is a traitor. A citizen who yearns for freedom is a traitor, and those who are criminals or belong to a secret society ... are the worst traitors!. Search for traitors using snitches, electric eyes or security robots. Many of your citizens are hiding a lot of secrets.

SECRET SOCIETIES - The unhappy citizens will join secret societies . The 'Runners' will try destroy you with cyberattacks, The 'Drones' will demand equality of social classes from you or they will destroy your complex. The 'Dreamers' will live in a virtual world and will not be productive, The 'Cult of sirius' will be your ally as long as you are their God, 'Antirobots' will destroy your robots, and the 'Protechs' will murder the last ones to save robots ... There are secret societies planned for the future of the game!.

CONTROL YOUR CITIZENS - Give them happiness pills, lock them up in isolation chambers, , implant chips in their brains, clone them, or turn them into pure energy... use your imagination but be careful, they may rebel against you.

AND GET READY FOR THE WAR - The attack from the other factions is eminent. Are you prepared for the endless war?.

Are you capable of achieving hive mind consciousness?. Can you build the final utopia?. Will you defeat your enemies?...

Your citizens are conspiring against you, it is essential to act quick. A WORLD OF PARANOIA.

boardgame.name: Virtù
boardgame.description:
It's a time of upheaval, when the Middle Ages end and modernity is born. For those in the government, the situation is ripe for action. Your city must maintain its standing, and you, as its prince, must make this happen.

Virtù takes place during the Italian Renaissance, with each player embodying one of the powerful Italian cities of the time and trying to make it more powerful than all others through "virtù", the ability to accomplish great things through a strong state (according to Machiavelli).

The foundation of the game is "wheelbuilding", that is, creating a "wheel of actions" on your personal player board, which has a unique arrangement compared to other players and with you having a different set of starting family cards. Depending on how you place the cards, you have multiple options available and a starting strategy, but you can acquire and place new cards to alter your approach over the course of the game. You interact with others indirectly by taking cards they want or racing to goals or directly by sending agents to the palace or their cities as well as by attacking cities. Artists, merchants, and diplomats can also work to increase your prestige.

Virtù includes a two-player mode that is played differently from the game with 3-5 players.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

boardgame.name: The Pandect of Thanatos
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Leilon, a mining city along the sword coast free from the control of a powerful wizard. Now an unyielding watch captain who hates magic is bent on keeping it from the city.

Recently, Tarick, a young scholar working at the Temple of Lathander library, attacked his mentor with magic. He had by all accounts been a good and smart scholar, but his recent demeanor had changed.

The stern watch captain wants Tarick found and brought back for justice dead or alive. He is willing to fight fire with fire even if he does have to employ outside magic-users. Under no circumstances will he allow magic to fester in this city again.

Adventurers will find that getting to the young culprit is no simple task. What dark place is he hiding? How many denizens of evil block their way? Will they be in time before there are more victims? And what secrets lie ahead?

boardgame.name: The Portal at Rix'Zus's Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a homebrew introductory adventure with a duration of 5 to 6 hours to accompany the official launch of the adventures in the Feywild, the plane of the fairies and sylvan creatures.

This adventure takes place in Vallencino, a small border town. The characters meet Filo (Fihloh), a conscious floating axe that asks for their help to reach a portal that will let it return to the Feywild. Filo will lead the characters to the heart of the ruined lair of the lich Rix'Zús, defeated by adventurers in the distant past; It is in this place that the remnant of the lich’s magical power is concentrated and with the help of the adventurers, the portal can be opened.

This place is guarded by a cult that recently took hold of the town's temple, what is their purpose?

Guide your players through this ancient dungeon and discover the secrets of the portal to the Feywild!

boardgame.name: The Coliseum
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Prepare for a Bloody Battle in The Coliseum!

Captured by the gnolls! The party must figure out why they've been left alive and what significance the date in five days' time carries as they plot to survive the brutal arena, escape and help their fellow captives, and bring down Yagrak and his Red Moon Pack.

boardgame.name: The Dark Watchman
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

As the river carves its way through the marsh, the Watchman, a 500 foot tall lighthouse overlooks the passing ships, lighting their way and alerting them to dangers that would lurk in the shadows. But what happens when the shadows extinguish the light, and what purpose do they have?

This adventure is designed for a party of characters around the third through fifth level with a combined total of about 20 levels.

boardgame.name: The Palace of Dreams
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

THE PALACE OF DREAMS is a module for Tier 2 gaming groups exploring the Feywild.

As your band of adventurers journey through the Fey Crossing you emerge in a beautiful blue and purple grove under an astonishing pink sunset, soon enough you stand in front of an alabaster palace of dreams. Will you be able to retrieve the Prophecy before being caught? Or will you discover things much darker in origin?

This supplement includes locations, descriptions, creatures, and a full-fledge 4 to 8 hours adventure in the Plane of Fairies.

boardgame.name: Shadows Over Whitarrows
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In recent weeks, a giant ice spider has set up its nest in a cave in an underground lake above Whitarrows. Its offspring grew rapidly, and the first spiders having reached a sufficient size left to hunt the local fauna, which quickly deserted the place. The arrival of this new predator is a real danger for the village, as it depletes resources at high speed. The scarcity of game has emboldened the arachnids, and now they hunt the hunters and trappers of Whitarrows. The intelligence of these monsters is limited, but their mother's intelligence is sufficient to consider an assault on the village.

Two groups of hunters and a group of loggers did not return. Tension is rising in the village, some wanting to go into the forest in search of this new danger, of which they are unaware of the origin, and others want to wait for better weather and reinforcements in the valley.

Either way, the spiders may descend on the village soon, and they must be prevented, otherwise the writings of the Order's monastery and the village will be lost. The eggs are ready to hatch, the Swarm Mother feeds them with the corpses of the villagers.

boardgame.name: Journée de merde
boardgame.description:
Your day started off pretty well but by adding "shitty day" cards to your story, you find that it just gets more and more rotten.

Accumulate awkward and embarrassing situations to have the worst shitty day by picking or placing a card.
The winner is the player with the high score (points are written on each card).
An aperitif game to spend hilarious evenings with friends.

boardgame.name: Armada: Seas Aflame Supplement
boardgame.description:
Ahoy there captains. Seas Aflame is a supplement book for Mantic's game of epic naval warfare: Armada. Take your games of Armada to the next level! With ten new scenarios, rules for fliers and fortifications as well as a full campaign system, the book also expands on the naval background in the world of Pannithor and introduces the next wave of fleets to be released for the Armada game.

Seas Aflame is an exciting new 72-page supplement for Armada. Inside you'll find:


new rules for fliers – take the battle to the skies
rules for adding coastal defences to your games
new upgrades
10 new scenarios
campaign rules that will see your fleet develop over time
background on upcoming fleets (elves, Twilight Kin, Salamanders, Northern Alliance and Varangur)


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Armada: The Game of Epic Naval Warfare Rulebook

boardgame.name: Das ÖVA-Spiel
boardgame.description: The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 65 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. At the beginning of the game and after the 4th turn the players have to pay an insurance fee.

boardgame.name: Plantarian
boardgame.description:
From the description:

This is a new background for Troika! Numinous Edition, for a humanoid plant creature.

boardgame.name: The Curse of Blackwood
boardgame.description:
From the description:

'The Curse of Blackwood'

high in the head of a gnarled, black tree
wreathed in cursed magick and beset by beasts
the home of knights who now laze in it's shade
lie treasures most foul, and a kingdom of fowl to be made

'The Curse of Blackwood' is a 13 page adventure for the Mausritter rpg system that's chock full of original magic items, spells, enemies and dungeon rooms all illustrated and written by yours truly. Inside the pdf you'll find...

- 11 beautifully described dungeon rooms, full of traps, puzzles and original enemies
- The Knights of Blackwood, a traumatized lot of wrens and rats who've been banished from their fortress home
- Over 2 dozen original illustrations including 2 isometric dungeon maps, unique treasures, magic swords and enemies
- 'The Raven' a terrifying beast of a bird that'll leave your players scrambling to defeat her
- A print-friendly version that'll require much much less black ink, for all you 'in person' players out there. [Comes with several 'inverse' treasures; mirrors of the ravens's treasure hoard but with flipped magical functions]
- And a massive treasure hoard, packed with 6 new magic items. Sell them for a mountain of pips or use their magical properties profit in other ways

boardgame.name: Data Seeds Volume 3
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Data Seeds Volume 3 follows in the footsteps of the previous two volumes, providing a small collection of Data Seeds, designed to expand the content contained within our Quick Start. This publication is also fully compatible with the upcoming core book.

Volume 3 puts the Mercs into the aftermath of a violent exchange which leaves one team member fighting for their life, sends the team into the seedy club world of the Paris-zone looking for a client's stolen memories, and deep underground in search of a hidden cryo-vault and some long lost secrets. This PDF release also contains the details of NPCs and new equipment needed for these adventures.
